org.ardenus

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ardenus.Window

  • public class Window
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a GLFW window.
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin

      • isCursorInRange

        public boolean isCursorInRange()
        This method is used to check if a mouse cursor is in range of the window. This is NOT the same as isWindowFocused(). isWindowFocused() is used to check if the window has been clicked on by the mouse, while this function checks to see if the mouse is still in range of the window. This can still return false even if the window is focused!
        Returns:
        true if the mouse cursor is in range of the window, false otherwise.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys the window.
